ROUTE
NATIONAL PARK
National Park

Eager for an adventure while riding a Sumatran elephant? Let’s stepping out our track,Tangkahan ecotourism which is located in, Batang Serangan Langkat, North Sumatra. Known as the hidden paradise of North Sumatra, Tangkahan is a part of Gunung Leuser National Park.

Let’s stepping out our track,Tangkahan ecotourism which is located in, Batang Serangan Langkat, North Sumatra. Known as the hidden paradise of North Sumatra, Tangkahan is a part of Gunung Leuser National Park. The park has a forest patrol team consisting elephants and their trainer, the Srati. Visitors can join them when they are doing their joib. This real journey could take a few days in the depth of the forest along Tangkahan to Bukit Lawang.

The name of this national park is taken from the name of a river which flows inside the park, Batang Gadis. The park is of importance for the wildlife living adjacent to the park. They moved to the park because their habitat was destroyed by land clearing and fire. The park is spaning along Bukit Barisan mountain and sits at the height of 300 – 2.145 meter above sea level. Mount Sorik Marapi is the highest peak.

In 2004, the area was converted into a national park covering an area of 38.000 Hectares. It was then expanded into 83.000 Hectares in 2009. This was the right action considering that the area is like an emerald which is rich in tropical biodiversity of rainforest Sumatra.

Siberut National Park is among ten national parks in Indonesia acknowledged as Biosphere Reserve. This parks sits in Mentawai Island, West Sumatera, or 155 Km away from Padang, the capital city of West Sumatera province. Sixty percent of the park area is covered with primary forest of Dipterocarpacear, mixed primary forest, swamp area, coastal area and mangrove forest. The forest in this park is still pristine composting of big stems and densed forest canopy reaching 60 meter height.
Standing in Kerinci Seblat National Park, Kerinci summit is often shrouded by fog. The mystery of this active mountain lures a lot of people. Sub-alpine covers the top of Mount Kerinci.

As the name suggests, Bukit Duabelas (12 main hils) are in the asylum area of 60,500 hectares in three districts: Sarolangun, Bungo Tebo and Batang. Nowadays it stretches from the landscape to the unique natural scenery.

Bukit Tigapuluh National Park spreads out on the steep hills just in the middle of the lowland of Sumatera island. Geographically, this area is separated from the chain of Bukit Barisan ridge which extends along the western part of Sumatera. Once you explores the park, you will feel the high humidity of tropical air, yet it will make you sweating. Four types of ecosystems form the landscape of Bukit Tigapuluh National Park; pristine forest, logged-over area, bushes, rubber plantation and field.

Berbak National Park, the largest wetland conservation area in Southeast Asia, stores the largest carbon in the world. On the other hand, Sembilang National Park on Sumatra Island is a haven for thousands of East Asian and Australian migratory birds, including peat swamp forests and riparian forests.

Located at the southern line of Bukit Barisan mountains, Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park is a home for large mammals such as Sumatran tigers (Panthera tigris sumatrensis), Sumatran elephants (Elephas maximus sumatranus) and Sumatran rhinos (Dicerorhinus sumatrensis).

Way Kambas National Park was drawn attention from the world after the birth of Andatu in 2012. This baby Sumatran Rhinoceros (Dicerorhinus sumatraensis). has given a triumph for the park. A hard effort has delivered to support a semi-in-situ captive of Way Kambas’ Sumatran Rhino Sanctuary. Literally, Andatu stands for ‘Anugerah dari Tuhan’ meaning Gift from God. Also, people may know Andatu as a baby from Andalas and Ratu, his parents.

Gunung Palung National Park is the only Dipterocarpaceae tropical rain forest which is considered to be the best and widest forest in Kalimantan island. This forest cover is a chain of hills and significantly important as a water resource for the locals. The topography of the park varies from lowland to highland. Two mountain summits stand in the middle of the park.

Bentarum National Park, located in West Kalimantan, is the largest conservation area in the region. Known for its two different faces during the rainy and dry seasons, this park includes Lake Sentarum and Betung Kerihun. This area offers a variety of ecosystems, such as lowland forests, swamp forests, old secondary forests and Dipterocarpus forests. The park is also home to 75 percent of Kalimantan\'s endemic plants, making it an important heartland for Kalimantan\'s biodiversity.

Bukit Baka - Bukit Raya National Park may sound a little unique. This park isa combination of two national nature reserves of thetwo provinces, namely Bukit Baka Nature Reserve in West Kalimantan, and Bukit Raya Nature Reserve in Central Kalimantan. The biodiversity of Bukit Baka - Bukit Raya is also abundant: 817 plant species out of 139 families.

Borneo Orangutan (Pongo pygmaeus) Rehabilitation Center in Camp Leaky has been the main tourist attraction in Tanjung Puting National Park,Pangkalan Bun, Kotawaringin Barat, Central Kalimantan. The research center was builtin the 1970s. The attraction here is the feeding time of the only Asian great ape, the Orangutan.

Sebangau National Park is a representative of swamp peat forest ecosystem di Central Kalimantan that supports three watercatchment area; Sebangau, Kahayan, and Katingan. The park maintains and cares of these catchment areas and supports the life of human and wildlife. The local tribe, Dayak people rely their transportation mobility on the rivers flowing in the park. They travel from one village to another, using traditional canoe as their local transportation.

Just like Betung Kerihun National Park, Kayan Mentarang National Park is also located adjacent to the neighbouring country, Malaysia at two points ;Sarawak on the west and Sabah the north. Located at the border of Indonesia and Malaysia serves this park as a fort to the nation in term of sovereignty as well as the sustainability of its natural resources. This conservation area witnessed the ancient civilization. It is shown by the existence of trace of graves and stone-age tools at some of archaeological sites.

Sangkima and Camp Kakap represent the showcase of natural cruising in Kutai National Park. These places are well known by tourists.Sangkima invites visitors to penetrate the lowland forest of Kalimantan. It is located just along the main road connecting Bontang to Sangata. Sangkima can easily be reached from East Kutai District. In Sangkima, It is very likely seeing the primate such as :Orangutan (Pongo pygmaeus), Beruk (Macaca nemestrina), Long-tailed Macaque (Macaca fascicularis).

A very distinctive karst landscape stands as natural sculptures in the Bantimurung Bulusaraung National Park, Maros, South Sulawesi. No wonder it is often called as a karst tower. Because, It is standing tall with sharp fractures. Karst formation in Maros is recognized as the second largest karst landscape. The first is in southern China.

Dozens taka, Bungin, and the islands forms the landscape of Taka Bonerate. String of small islands, and the lagoon from the sand sediment, broken coral and shells form the younger soils. The word of Taka Bonerate itself means reef on the sand. The region once known as tiger atolls (tiger land) comprising of store barrier reef, fringing reef (fringing reef) and ring reef (atoll).

Stretching from the tip of South East Sulawesi, Rawa Aopa Watumohai National Park has significant responsibility to protect the Wallacea wetland ecosystem. Measuring an area of 105.194 hectares, the park is just like a giant water catchment for the island. As a supporting life system, the park is acknowledged as the World Ramsar Site.

Ranging at the heart of the World’s Coral Triangle, Wakatobi is visualized as a miniature of an archipelago. In the bright sun,Wakatobi National Park which is lying in Southeast Sulawesi, invites travelers to drop their anchors from one to another Pier. Wakatobi originates from the name of islands: Wangi–Wangi, Kaledupa, Tomia, and Binongko.

The charming of biodiveristyendemic to Wallacea is blended with the cultural heritage of Lembah Besoa. The ancient megatlihicum sites make the park’s uniqueness as the is the only national park in Indonesia which stores the sites. Lore Lindu is also blessed with beautiful landscape. The park which covers 217 hectares of conservation area are vary in height ; from the lowest of 300 meters above sea level to the highest of 2.610 meters above sea level where Mount Tokosa seated.

Kepulauan Togean is a national park which is located in Central Sulawesi. This national park is composed of small islands that store the typical biodiversity of marine area. Some endemic species found in park. Hidden in the Gulf of Tomini, Kepulauan Togean National Park is a paradise of small islands surrounded by reef coral. This park is included in the World Coral Triangle or the Coral Triangle, so this national park is very important to be proteced.

North Sulawesi is not only having Bunaken National Park. Three hours from the city of Manado, precisely in Kotamobagu, there is also a conservation area known as Bogani Nani Warta Bone National Park. The national park protects some endangered wildlife, such as Maleo birds (Macrocephalon maleo) and low land Anoa.

Bunaken is known worldwide as a paradise for diving lovers. The island has also been one of the favourite marine tourist destinations in the country. Bunaken island is a part of Bunaken National Park, located in Manado, North Sulawesi. Manado Tua, Mantehage, Siladen, and Nain are other main islands landscaping the park. Bunaken is easily accessed from Manado. It takes 45 minutes only by boat.

This National park which is lying on the western edge of Java is very challenging to see the Javan rhino at first hand (Rhinoceros sondaicus). Although they only have limited spread areas in Cikeusik and Citadahan, but it is always a challenge to watch one-horned animals from Ranggon, a 5 – 7 meters height of bamboo stage.

Oasis in the desert. That nickname is appropriate for Kepulauan Seribu National Park. A natural white sandy islands and a great underwater world offer a piece of paradise for travelers. Facts that the location is near to Jakarta, Kepulauan Seribu deserves to make a perfect vacation on the weekend. Underwater beauty awaits you to enjoy.

This national park is asserted itself as the largest tropical mountain rain forest remaining on the island of Java. This area is covered with a wallowed germplasms of natural forest. The dense forest of Halimun is inhabited by rare primates: Javan gibbon (Hylobates moloch) and Surili (Presbytis comata). Halimun Salak is also a habitat for endangered and protected species, the Javan Hawk Eagle (Nisaetus bartelsi) and the Javan tiger (Panthera pardus melas).

Who does not know Gunung Gede Pangrango National Park? The ease of its accessibility make it easier for visitors from Jakarta, Bogor, Sukabumi coming to the park. An impression of romantic voyage generally said by visitors after spending their time exploring the park.

Mount Ciremai was last exploded in 1938. It has beautiful appearance; undulating, hilly and a mountain range. The summit is like a cone. Mount Ciremai sits at the height of 3.078 meter above sea level, surrounded by terraces of rice fields, cold air and clear rivers. With an area of 15.500 hectares, the park is important as water reservoir for the people living adjacent to the park. It becomes the headwaters of 43 rivers, 156 water springs, and 147 out of it drains water continuously throughout the year with the quality of drinking water.

Off the Central Java coast, the Java Sea reefs are tucked peacefully in Karimunjawa Islands. Besides Kepulauan Seribu in Jakarta, the park could be an option for divers. So, take a glance into this area. The coral reefs can be enjoyed by snorkeling and diving. Divers can explore up to 20 feet in depth. Diving usually takes place in islands of Small Menjangan, Cemara Besar, and Tengah Island.

Nine craters resulted from Mount Merbabu eruption had became geology phenomena in central Java. Gunung Merbabu National Park has two summits which are kept geological material ; loose material and melted lava. Merbabu is best for them who want to climb until the summit while observing the geological process hundred years ago.

Towering majestically on the north horizon, the summit of Mount Merapi are affirmed as the landmark of the landscape and cultural of Yogyakarta. The earth pole which is known for being very active in Indonesia is one of the most 16 active volcano in the globe. Its charm like a magnet for them, the mountain climber and the wild nature lover. Every time Mount Merapi twists the earth, it will attract the attention of vulcanologist and geologist all over the world.

Usually, watching the crater of the mountain closely to the steep trail must trace all odds of nature. However, without those kind of struggles, tourists can reach Bromo crater rim easily. The crater is located in Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park. A stretch of vast sea of sand is in between the gate of the park and the crater. Visitors are crossing the sandy ocean towards the crater either on foot, by jeep or riding horses just like a cowboy horseback.

The landscape of water and land have become the last fortress for various fauna and flora on the south part of East Java. Directly adjacent to the Indian Ocean, Meru Betiri is a stopover for four of the seven types of sea turtles in the world. Green turtle (Chelonia mydas), Hawksbill (Eretmochelys imbricata), slengkrah (Lepidochelys olivacea), and Leatherback turtle (Dermochelys coriacea) visited the coastal of Meru Betiri to bury their eggs.
Baluran National park is located in Situbondo, East Java. A piece of tiny savanna with its wildlife makes the park is very well known as the tiny African of Java.

Alas Purwo is not just a piece of wilderness. The forest has an intimate bonding of the local’s cultural and religious nuances. Alas Purwo National Park which is located in Banyuwangi, East Java is well known as a land for the rover.

White cotton fluffy mixed with a beautiful blue streaks around the eyes. This is how Bali starling which is naturally living only in Bali look like. British ornithologist Baron Stressmann found this starling as Leucopsar rothschildi on March 24, 1911. The discovery took place when the Maluku Ship Expedition II carrying researchers. The ship was forced to be landed in Singaraja for 3 months.

It was told that in the past Mount Rinjani had ever reached its height at 5.000 meters above sea level. Nowadays, the summit of Rinjani has been one of the most popular tourist destinations in Gunung Rinjani National Park, West Nusa Tenggara and even in the country. The peak of Rinjani is now decreasing at 3.726 meters above sea level. Mount Rinjani, which is currently the second highest mountain in Indonesia, is still active. History records its powerful eruption in 1884 and the last on November 3, 1994.

From the sky, a thread of islands, large and small, seems to float in the Komodo Ocean. Arid and barren, that was the first impression upon seeing the islands. However, the clear and bluish sea water, on which the islands float, washed out the impression. Brown and blue, they make a perfect combination of colour. Komodo, Rinca, Padar, Gili Mota, Nusa Kode and other small islands compose Komodo National Park, Manggarai, East Nusa Tenggara. The park is the home of the Komodo Dragon (Varanus komodoensis).

Manupeu Tanah Daru National Park offers the charm of the Lapopu waterfall that amazes travelers on a journey full of challenges. Meanwhile, Laiwangi Wanggameti National Park in Sumba, which covers hilly areas to the horizon, has a dense canopy and plays an important role in storing water reserves that are much needed by local communities during the dry season.

At the peak of Kelimutu, Ende, East Nusa Tenggara, three lakes is spanning as the silent witness to the abode of ancestral spirits of the Lio community. A red Atapolo lake for evil spirits; a Turquoise Nua Muri Koo Fai for youths spirits, and Black Ata Mbupu for elder or wise spirit. Not far from the gate of the national park, there lies a large rock called Perekonde. Lio society believes, this is the gate of the court where the spirit gets appropriate judgment for their behavior during their life in the world.

Standing with elegant at di Semenanjung Sanggar, Sumbawa Island, two decades ago, Tambora shaked the world. Nowadays, in its silence, Tambora offers a stunning beauty of nature and resources for human around. After two years of its explosion, Tambora was appointed as national park by the Ministry of Environment and Forestry of Indonesia, with an area of 71.645 hectare.

Aketajawe Lolobata National park is situated in Central Halmahera, Kota Tidore Kepulauan and East Halmahera, North Maluku Province. For bird lovers, this place is just like a paradise. The North Maluku has 243 bird species and 26 out of it is endemic to the region. Meanwhile, Halmahera it self has 211 bird species and 24 out if it is endemic. Bird endemic of Halmahera are Invisible rail (Habroptila walacei), Blue and white kingfisher (Todiramphus diops), Halmahera cukcoo-shire (Coracina parvula), and Dusky- brown oriole (Oriolus phaeochromus).

Manusela is a natural showcase for Seram\'s various ecosystems: beaches, swamp forests, lowland rain forests and mountain rain forests. From the coastline to the mountains, Manusela presents a variety of vegetation types on Seram Island. Starting from mangroves, beaches, swamp forests, river cliffs, tropical rain forests, mountain forests, to sub-alpine forests.

As far as the eye sight, the ocean dominates the landscape of Teluk Cendrawasih National Park. This park is located at the edge of Pacific Ocean, just right at the meeting point of tectonic plate of Australia continent and Pacific. The geological history had made the park rich ini biodiversity.

With 2.35 million hectares area, this national park was assigned as an Asean Herritage Parks in 2004. Having the most gallant and interesting karst caves formations in the world, it makes the park is very unique. Lorentz National Park has a complete ecosystem started from the highland to the wetland at Arafura beach. It represents ecosystem gradation which is ranging in the height of 0 – 4.884 above sea level on which Mount Trikora and Jaya are seated. The Cartenz summit, the highest peak in South-east Asia is well known to have the eternal snow. The park was recognized as one of the World Heritage Site from UNESCO.

The nature of Wasur has two distinctive weather along with the changes in season. The transition periode is due when the season is changed. During rainy season, the swamp is fully watered. In contrast, it will empty during the dry season. The base of the swamp dries gradually and the soil is cracking. Only small patches with a little water in it are left behind. The preservation of Wasur is in line with the locals wisdom and norms. Its quote is used as the motto of Merauke District: Izakod Bekai Izakod Kai: One Heart One Goal. The local still here the customary law in order to keep the human relationship with nature.

Located in the Siak District of Riau Province, Zamrud National Park was declared the 52nd national park in the country on July 22, 2016. The park\'s original area was once a Wildlife Sanctuary of Lake Zamrud, covering 30 hectares of forest. It was later expanded to its current size of 31,340 hectares when it received its national park designation. This national park is primarily characterized by its peat swamp forest ecosystem and serves as a vital refuge for the surrounding area. Zamrud National Park is home to 38 bird species, with 12 of them being protected species, including the White stork and various hornbill species. The park also houses the Serindit Melayu (Lariculus galgulus), which serves as an iconic species for the region.

In the same year as the declaration of Zamrud National Park, in the central part of Indonesia, precisely in the West Sulawesi Province, Gandang Dewata National Park was also born. This 53rd National Park is located in three regencies: Mamasa, Central Mamuju, and Mamuju. Its high biodiversity level, along with its authenticity and uniqueness, serves as the main basis for designating this area as a national park.

Mount Maras standing on the land of Bangka together with other hills namely Nangka, Terang, Tambun Tulang, and Perayun. The term "mountain" for Maras is actually unusual. Mount Maras was determined as a national park on 27 July 2016 as the 54th national park in Indonesia. Mount Maras National Park is located in two sub-districts, Riau Silip and Kelapa, Bangka Barat and Bangka District, Province of Bangka Belitung. The uniqueness of Mount Maras is represented by its richness in ecosystem types, which is united in one landscape; mangrove, mountain forest, and lowland forest.
Change language
Indonesia
English
Exploring the natural beauty of Gunung Leuser National Park. Step by step, journeying through the exquisite rainforest teeming with rare plants and animals.

One of the best white water rafting spots in Indonesia. Commercial white water rafting in the Alas River was first introduced by SOBEK EXPEDITION in the 1970s. Rafting down the Alas River offers a unique perspective of Gunung Leuser National Park. The beauty and natural wonder, the flora and fauna, can be appreciated from the rubber boat while conquering the river rapids.
Rubbing, touching, and caressing the rough fur and thick skin of Sumatran elephants leaves a profound impression on tourists during the animal bathing experience.
Witnessing the release of hatchlings into the sea, giving them the chance to grow and embark on their journey into the underwater world full of beauty.

Riding these friendly native elephants. With breathtaking natural scenery as the backdrop, you can experience a unique connection with the wild. While traversing the lush forest and listening to the whispers of the leaves, these elephants will take you on a journey to explore the beauty of Gunung Leuser National Park.

The Sumatran Orangutan (Pongo abelii) has captivated tourists from around the world. The Sumatran Orangutan Observation Center is located in Bukit Lawang Plantation Village, Bahorok, Langkat. Observing Sumatran orangutans is a highlight during the jungle adventure in Bukit Lawang.

Want to go on an adventure while riding Sumatran elephants? Visit the ecotourism area of Tangkahan, Batang Serangan, Langkat, North Sumatra. Known as a hidden paradise in North Sumatra, Tangkahan is situated within Gunung Leuser National Park.
Behold the unique natural beauty of Gunung Leuser! In Gunung Leuser National Park, we can see the endangered sea turtle, a rare species that needs our protection.

The magnificent sight of Rafflesia atjehensis in Gunung Leuser National Park. This rare natural beauty is one of the largest species of Rafflesia in the world, with striking flowers that can grow up to one meter in size!

The nearly mystical beauty of Pygmy Water Lily in Gunung Leuser National Park. Hidden among the lush greenery, these small flowers bloom on the water\'s surface, creating an incredibly beautiful view.
Enjoy an exciting adventure in Batang Gadis National Park with the thrilling tubing activity. Dive into the flowing river amidst the tropical forest and experience unparalleled joy.

Visit Batang Gadis National Park and explore the beauty of local culture with the traditional Sibanggor houses. Witness well-preserved architecture and immerse yourself in the midst of magnificent wilderness.
Hiking in Batang Gadis National Park. Enjoy an exhilarating adventure with unforgettable scenic views in the pristine wilderness.
Aek Cunek is a 100-meter-high waterfall with beautiful natural scenery.
The Sumatran Tiger, a symbol of strength and grace in Batang Gadis National Park. Visit to witness the astonishing beauty of the wild.
Witness the beauty of the wild: The Great Argus Pheasant, the jewel of Batang Gadis National Park. Come and witness the captivating wonder of wildlife.
Extraordinary natural beauty in Batang Gadis National Park: The enchanting Dancing Orchid. Explore this natural wonder now!
Nepenthes, the insect-eating plant in Batang Gadis National Park. Astonishing beauty of the wild awaits to be explored.
In Batang Gadis National Park, Rafflesia meijerri grows alongside wild mushrooms. Witness this unique beauty and discover the wonders of nature with every step you take.
Enjoy moments of relaxation and observe wildlife in Tesso Nilo National Park through bird watching. Witness a variety of unique forest birds in their natural habitat.
Gain an unforgettable learning experience with elephant education in Tesso Nilo National Park. Get to know the life and special protection of elephants up close.
Follow in the footsteps of environmental heroes in Tesso Nilo National Park by learning traditional martial art, Silat Pangean.
Witness joyful moments as elephants in Tesso Nilo National Park enjoy their bathing time. An experience that brings you closer to these extraordinary creatures amidst the beauty of nature.

No need to worry about mud stains when exploring the forest, as the nature trail has been paved with paving blocks. Along the three-kilometer journey, visitors\' eyes will be delighted by the shade of giant trees.
Tesso Nilo area has become one of the key conservation centers for wildlife habitats, with approximately 150 elephants.
The beauty of Tesso Nilo National Park is experienced through the enchantment of the wild, including the Rhinoceros Hornbill, which is an integral part of its ecosystem.
Explore the nocturnal life in Tesso Nilo National Park, where various types of frogs gather and create unique sounds.
Observing the colorful and cheerful variety of birds in Tesso Nilo National Park makes every adventure here unforgettable.
The carnivorous pitcher plant, a unique insect-eating plant, is one of the species found in Tesso Nilo National Park.
Enjoy the beauty of local culture with the traditional Turuk Laggai dance in Siberut National Park.
Immerse yourself in the unique cultural wisdom of the Siberut community.
Witness the beautiful moment of hatchling release, a symbol of new hope in the heart of the Siberut forest.
Captivated by the vibrant colors of the Asystasia Gangetica flowers that bloom in Siberut National Park.
Explore plant diversity by discovering the unique pitcher plant within the Siberut forest.
Witness the rare Montrouziera Cauliflora tree, a natural wonder in Siberut National Park.
Let\'s go in search of the Bilau Gibbon, a primate that is an integral part of the Siberut forest ecosystem.
Approaching the summit of Mount Kerinci, greenery becomes increasingly rare. At a glance, this crystal-clear panorama presents the tropical landscape of Sumatra.
Witness the natural beauty by visiting the Lumpo Waterfall in Kerinci Seblat National Park.
Enjoy an adventure by exploring the enchanting river with a boat in Kerinci Seblat National Park.
The Sumatran tiger roams the lush forests of Kerinci. The grandeur of this big cat is evident from the nickname given by the people: "Si Datuk."
Encounter the binturong, a unique animal in Kerinci Seblat National Park.
Shrouded in the dimness of the rainforest, the Rafflesia arnoldi flower blooms in a burst of color, as if painting the wilderness.
Enjoy an exciting adventure with hiking in Bukit Duabelas National Park. Explore the unique nature and culture.
Embrace the hospitality of the Orang Rimba community by visiting their traditional houses in Bukit Duabelas National Park. An unforgettable cultural experience.
Meet the Orang Rimba community living in harmony with nature in Bukit Duabelas National Park. A fascinating cultural diversity.
Siamang, one of the many amazing creatures you\'ll encounter in Bukit Duabelas National Park. A captivating biodiversity.
Bulbophyllum Patens, one of the many plant species thriving in Bukit Duabelas National Park. A natural beauty that needs preservation.
Dipodium Scardens, an exotic orchid thriving in Bukit Duabelas National Park. Enchanting natural beauty.
Meranti Bunga, a unique plant that is a vital part of Bukit Duabelas National Park\'s ecosystem. A natural wonder that must be conserved.
Nepenthes, the captivating carnivorous plant in Bukit Duabelas National Park. Biodiversity that we need to protect together.
Experience an extraordinary adventure with Jungle Run in Bukit Tigapuluh National Park. Adrenaline and natural beauty in one package.
Speed across the water on a speedboat in Bukit Tigapuluh National Park. Glide along the mesmerizing river at high speed.
Tourist attractions in Bukit Tigapuluh National Park, besides camping, can also be used for trailing, hiking, and bird watching.
The Crimson-winged Woodpecker, one of the many birds that enhance the biodiversity of Bukit Tigapuluh National Park. The beauty of natural colors.
The Hornbill, a giant bird with a striking beak that plays an essential role in the ecosystem of Bukit Tigapuluh National Park. A natural uniqueness that needs to be preserved.
The Tapir, an exotic herbivorous animal that roams the forests of Bukit Tigapuluh National Park. A natural wonder that must be conserved.
The Copper-cheeked Frog, a water-dwelling creature essential for the biodiversity of Bukit Tigapuluh National Park.
The Sumatran Tiger, a captivating predator in Bukit Tigapuluh National Park. A symbol of the beauty and power of nature.
Enjoy the beauty of nature while bird-watching in Berbak and Sembilang National Park.
Explore the beauty of the rivers by boat in Berbak and Sembilang National Park. An exciting water adventure.
Immerse yourself in nature through trailing in Berbak and Sembilang National Park. A winding adventure in the breathtaking forest.
Witness the beauty of the sunrise from Dusun Sembilang in Berbak and Sembilang National Park. An inspiring morning.
Learn about the traditional process of making shrimp paste in Berbak and Sembilang National Park. A culture lesson filled with aroma.
The Sumatran Elephant, one of the dominant animals in the biodiversity of Berbak and Sembilang National Park. A natural wonder that needs preservation.
Crocodiles, powerful predators living in the rivers of Berbak and Sembilang National Park. An integral part of the river ecosystem.
Cockatoos, exotic birds that adorn the skies of Berbak and Sembilang National Park. Captivating fauna diversity.
Orangutans, charming primates that live in the forests of Berbak and Sembilang National Park. An inspiring biodiversity.
The Pitcher Plant, a unique carnivorous plant, thrives in Berbak and Sembilang National Park. A unique flora that must be preserved.
Dare to try white water rafting in Cilik River? Feel the thrilling adventure in Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park.
Witness the stunning beauty of Talang Bukit crater in Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park.
Gain insights into the environment at Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park by participating in the phenology learning program at Way Canguk Research Station.
The biodiversity of Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park also includes exotic turtles.
The great hornbill nests in tree cavities within the forest.
Rafflesia arnoldii perches on liana tree trunks.
The Sumatran elephant, one of the key species in the biodiversity of Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park. A natural wonder that needs to be preserved.
Enjoy a camping adventure in Way Kambas National Park. A starry night in the midst of the wilderness.
Join exciting tours in Way Kambas National Park. Explore the natural riches and local culture.
Experience a special moment of feeding elephants in Way Kambas National Park. An unforgettable interaction with these majestic creatures.
Observe the beauty of wild birds in Way Kambas National Park. An amazing bird-watching experience.
Witness the cultural beauty with Lampung dance in Way Kambas National Park. Culture thriving in the wilderness.
The Sumatran rhinoceros, one of the protected species in Way Kambas National Park. Biodiversity that needs to be preserved.
Bears, powerful animals living in the forests of Way Kambas National Park. Their presence adds to the extraordinary natural wealth.
Tigers, powerful predators and one of the icons of Way Kambas National Park. Their presence is a source of pride for nature.
Elephants, majestic creatures that roam the forests of Way Kambas National Park. An inseparable part of biodiversity.
Rimba Duck, a rare bird that is a hallmark of Way Kambas National Park. The captivating charm of wildlife.

Climbing to the peak of Mount Gede will take you through dense mossy forests. Mosses like Doranopteris and Usnea will make mountaineers feel as if they are in a fairyland. At the summit of Mount Gede, the expanse of mountain Cantigi will welcome the climbers. The natural charm of Gede Pangrango lies in the bed of Edelweiss flowers, which captivates climbers.
Enjoy the tranquility of Situgunung Lake in the Gede Pangrango National Park. A calming natural atmosphere for relaxation and enjoying beautiful views.

Witness the uniqueness of the Gede Pangrango National Park with the Javan tree frog blending into the green environment.
The Gede Pangrango Complex becomes a hunting ground for the Javan leopard. There are two forms of the Javan leopard: the clouded leopard and the spotted leopard, as seen in the picture.
Among the lush forest canopy, the Javan Gibbon (Hylobates moloch) sometimes leaps from tree to tree.
Witness the beauty of the endemic plant, Raflesia Rochussenii, which grows in the Gede Pangrango National Park.
As the morning approaches, the glow of the morning sun combines with the dew on the Cantigi and Edelweiss peaks, leaving memories for anyone to return to Mount Gede Pangrango.

Enjoy the fun waves with bodyboarding on the beach, Meru Betiri National Park. The exciting sensation of riding the sea waves for a thrilling holiday experience.
Relax with a canoe trip in Meru Betiri National Park. Explore the waters and appreciate the beauty of nature.

Travelers can share their love by burying turtle eggs in the hatchery. When they hatch, baby turtles scatter around the hatchery and are cared for. When ready, the baby turtles are released back on Sukamade Beach.
Sukamade\'s charm places this beach in the promoted diamond triangle destination by the Banyuwangi Regency government and the Meru Betiri National Park Office.
The beauty of Bandelit Beach on the east side of Java Island.
Meru Betiri bears the responsibility of conserving sea turtles. Amidst the hustle and bustle of Java\'s density, Meru Betiri invites a return to serenity in preserving sea turtles.
The leopard, one of the essential predators in the ecosystem of these forests.
The Meru Betiri wilderness shelters the Javan Hawk Eagle (Nisaetus bartelsi), an endemic Javanese bird of prey.
Observe the playful antics of gray macaques living freely in Meru Betiri National Park. Cheerful forest residents who will entertain you during your journey.
One of the phenomenal plants, Padmosari (Rafflesia zollingeriana), can still be encountered by the public within this conservation area.

Another easily spotted wildlife is the Green Peafowl (Pavo muticus), especially during their mating season from July to November. Before dawn breaks, the calls of the male peafowls shatter the silence, inviting the females in response.
Witness the beauty of Baluran National Park\'s wilderness through the presence of the green junglefowl. They are an inseparable part of the rich biodiversity of this forest.
Playful squirrels inhabit Baluran National Park. These cheerful creatures are always ready to greet you with their cuteness.
A variety of wildlife can be seen grazing in the Bekol savannah, including the Wild Buffalo (Bubalus bubalis). Wild buffaloes are easily found near the scattered water holes around the savannah.
